ASSIGNMENT1399 WAS HUMPING CARS OFF THE RIP LEAD TO THE HUMP LEAD. ON REACHING A POINT JUST WEST OF THE RIP LEAD/HUMP LEAD SWITCH, THE CREW STOPPED DUE TO AN EXTRA CAR IN THEIR CUT. THE SLACK IN THE CUT RAN EASTWARD WITH GATX 56366, 85TH CAR ON WEST YD 26, LOAD PETROLEUM WAX, SIDESWIPING & DERAILING ENG 1557 ON THE HUMP LEAD. THE HUMP YARDMASTERDID NOT GIVE PERMISSION TO ASSIGNMENT 1303 TO COME EASTWARD. AN INVESTIGATION WAS SCHEDULED FOR ASSIGMENT 1303. YARD HELPER SIGNED A WAIVER FOR A 30-DAY DEFERRED SUSPENSION.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

RT19941-d-11-05-94-RT.Contributing Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
RT19941-d-11-05-94-RT.Narrative: CREW 121 PLACED A RESIDUE CAR, COVERED HOPPER NAHX 99760, WHICH LAST CONTAINED CALCIUM CARBIDE, ON TRACK 500, CLEARING TRACK 79A SWITCH. AFTER SETTING THAT CAR OUT, THE CREW PULLED SEVEN EMPTY GONDOLAS FROM THE B.O.F. SCRAP YARD WHICH WERE GOING TO BE WEIGHTED ALONG WITH THE EMPTY CARBIDE CAR. AS THE CREW WAS SHOVING THE EMPTY GONDOLAS NORTH ON TRACK 79A, THE EMPTY CARBIDE CAR, NAHX 99760, BEGAN TO ROLL NORTH ON TRACK 500 ALSO. THE TRAINMAN RIDING THE HIND-END OF THE DRAG OF GONDOLAS SAW THIS OCCUR AND ALLEGEDLY GAVE A SIGNAL TO HIS CREW MEMBERS, ALL OF WHOM WERE IN THE LOCOMOTIVE CAB, TO STOPTHE SHOVING MOVEMENT BECAUSE THE HIND CAR WAS HEADING TOWARD A COLLISION WITH THE CARBIDE CAR AT THE 500/79A TRACK SWITCH. SINCE THERE WAS NO RESPONSE TO THE SIGNAL AND THE MOVEMENT CONTINUED, THE TRAINMAN DISMOUNTED THE CAR AND RAN FROM THE IMMEDIATE AREA. THE INVESTIGATION OF THE INCIDENT REVEALED THAT THE CREW INDICATED THEY PLACED A BLOCK UNDER A WHEEL OF NAHX 99760 WHEN IT WAS PLACED ON TRACK 500. THEY FAILED TO SET A HAND BRAKE ON THE CAR WHICH ALONG WITH THE FAILURE TO HAVE THE CREW MEMBERS PROPERLY POSITIONED ON THE DRAG OF GONDOLAS BEING SHOVED, WERE THE MAIN FACTORS.NoneNoneNone

1094-d-11-10-94-CC.Narrative: IC OPERATOR AT CORWITH TOWER IMPROPERLY LINED 45 CROSSOVER SWITCH FROM NORTHBOUND MAIN BEING HELD BYBNP-72 FOR THE LEAD INTO GLENN YARD WHERE BRC-600 WAS SITTING. BNP-72 FAILED TO STOP SHORT OF IMPROPERLY LINED SWITCH & STRUCK BRC-600. BNP-72 HAD LUNAR INDICATION ON SIGNAL & WAS MOVING AGAINST TRAFFIC, REQUIRING IT TO MOVE AT RESTRICTED SPEED. IC OPERATOR IMPROPERLY ADVISED BNP-72 BY RADIO THAT "YOU GOT THE SIGNAL; COME ON, LET'S GO". BNP-72 OBSERVED SWITCH LINED WRONG & BRC-600 SITTING ON YARDLEAD APPROX. 6 CAR LENGTHS BEFORE GOING INTO LEAD, BUT WAS OPERATING AT A SPEED TOO HIGH TO STOP SHORT OF 45 CROSSOVER SWITCH OR BRC ENGINE 600 & COLLIDED WITH BRC-600. NO DERAILMENT OCCURRED.ALL ALCOHOL TESTS WERE NEGATIVE & DRUG TESTS ON THE CONDUCTOR & BRAKEMAN WERE NEGATIVE. DRUG TEST ON CC ENGINEER ORIGINALLY CAME BACK POSITIVE FOR A CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE; HOWEVER, THE MRO SUBSEQUENTLY RULED"INVALID" DUE TO "SPECIMEN LEFT UNATTENDED BEFORE BEING SIGNED AND SEALED" BY COLLECTION NURSE & EMPLOYEE.NoneNoneNoneNone
